main event: A ground-radar/ground-visual sighting of an unidentified object with high maneuverability and speed over New York City on March 2, 1962.
interesting points: The object was viewed at twilight and believed to be at an extreme height of over 20,000 feet with considerable relative speed.
The object exhibited maneuverability, speed, duration and reappearance characteristics that were not consistent with any known aircraft.
Visual observations indicated the object was a gray oval form made of a clear material, with no color, seam or glow.
The object moved eastward at an estimated speed of around 600 mph.
This case was evaluated as an unidentified sighting with no known correlation to any conventional aircraft.
